#Text=Prepare
#Text=Yourself for the Week Ahead
#Text=Do you find that your weekday evenings are absolutely absorbed by going to the gym , ferrying around the kids , catching up on chores , and more ?
#Text=Make things easier for yourself by taking time at the weekend to alleviate the midweek pressure .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Do your food shopping online .

#Text=Most leading supermarkets offer a deliver-to-your-door service that cuts out the hassle of roaming around a massive food outlet , crammed with hungry shoppers ( unless , of course , you live in the middle of nowhere ) .
#Text=Before buying anything , plan out your every meal for the week .
#Text=From this list of recipes , collate all the ingredients you will need .
#Text=By ordering online , you can save time and money ( no impulsive , in-store purchases of chocolate ice cream at 9pm ) .
#Text=Make meals ahead of time .
#Text=You can make every single meal you need for the week on Sunday , but this can be a messy and tiring operation .
#Text=A more time-effective tactic is to make the most of your appliances , such as your blender and your slow cooker .
#Text=For these meals , you will only need to cut up your fruit and vegetables in advance , freeze , and then throw them together for a breakfast smoothie or main meal .
#Text=Pinterest has some fantastic inspiration , so it â€™s worth doing some research .
#Text=Do the big cleaning jobs .

#Text=Definitely do nâ€™t spend your entire , precious weekend scrubbing every nook and cranny of your kitchen , but get the big jobs out of the way , like cleaning out your microwave or treating your sink .
#Text=You can always perform small maintenance jobs throughout the week , but you do nâ€™t want these tasks piling up on you when your time is short .
#Text=Who can face tackling the oven after a long day at work and a difficult session in the gym ?
#Text=Make room for treats and personal projects .
#Text=Whatever you â€™ve got in store for your week , make time to do the things you enjoy the most .
#Text=That could be watching your favourite programme with a tall glass of wine or picking up on an on-going , creative project .
#Text=When outlining your weekly routine , be sure to allow for an hour of relaxation time for yourself .
#Text=Create your schedule .
#Text=This can be a tedious process , but it â€™s possible to make it fun , too !
#Text=It may help to make your schedule as public as possible â€“ that means investing in a white board or painting yourself a chalkboard wall !
#Text=Unlike a diary , you ca nâ€™t ignore this beacon of reminders .
#Text=Manage your weekly closet .
#Text=Hopefully you â€™re up-to-date with your laundry .
#Text=If you are , that means you can create your weekly closet !
#Text=Assemble your daily outfits on hangers marked with the days of the week , and iron what needs ironing .
#Text=Pre-bag your gym kits ( if you need them ) and lay out your nightwear .
#Text=This will allow you an extra ten minutes or so in bed !
